text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/287153c5d481a09ffe98a95ad78390ff580bb557|patch 8.2.2069: the quickfix window is not updated after setqflist()>
patch 8.2.2069: the quickfix window is not updated after setqflist()

Problem:    The quickfix window is not updated after setqflist().
Solution:   Update the quickfix buffer. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #7390,
            closes #7385)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2069: the quickfix window is not updated after setqflist() · vim/vim@287153c

attachments.text: Problem: The quickfix window is not updated after setqflist(). Solution: Update the quickfix buffer. (Yegappan Lakshmanan, closes #7390, closes #7385)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b46f57e87b3706a8c4b97d8e03f7853a7938b061|patch 8.2.2068: transparent syntax item uses start/end of containing …>
patch 8.2.2068: transparent syntax item uses start/end of containing region

Problem:    Transparent syntax item uses start/end of containing region.
Solution:   Do not change the startpos and endpos of a transparent region to
            that of its containing region. (Adrian Ghizaru, closes #7349,
            closes #7391)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f5452691ba30e33b38c5b06c51ba40b58457d5d8|patch 8.2.2067: cursor position in popup terminal is wrong>
patch 8.2.2067: cursor position in popup terminal is wrong

Problem:    Cursor position in popup terminal is wrong.
Solution:   Don't check the flags.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ce2c5444e2556d8d156ab447d6d196f9ecd11ddc|patch 8.2.2066: Vim9: assignment with += doesn't work>
patch 8.2.2066: Vim9: assignment with += doesn't work

Problem:    Vim9: assignment with += doesn't work.
Solution:   Do not see the "+" as an addition operator.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2066: Vim9: assignment with += doesn't work · vim/vim@ce2c544
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2066: Vim9: assignment with += doesn't work · vim/vim@ce2c544
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: assignment with += doesn't work. Solution: Do not see the "+" as an addition operator.

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f8ca03bf9161ab9ee1a29db1d13c02b317c10029|patch 8.2.2065: using map() and filter() on a range() is inefficient>
patch 8.2.2065: using map() and filter() on a range() is inefficient

Problem:    Using map() and filter() on a range() is inefficient.
Solution:   Do not materialize the range. (closes #7388)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2065: using map() and filter() on a range() is inefficient · vim/vim@f8ca03b
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2065: using map() and filter() on a range() is inefficient · vim/vim@f8ca03b
attachments.text: Problem: Using map() and filter() on a range() is inefficient. Solution: Do not materialize the range. (closes #7388)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ebec3e29b83e6b5ccdd67a79993628871cda4b5b|patch 8.2.2064: terminal: cursor is on while redrawing, causing flicker>
patch 8.2.2064: terminal: cursor is on while redrawing, causing flicker

Problem:    terminal: cursor is on while redrawing, causing flicker.
Solution:   Switch the cursor off while redrawing.  Always add the top and
            left offset to the cursor position when not done already.
            (closes #5943)

patch 8.2.2063: Vim9: only one level of indexing supported

Problem:    Vim9: only one level of indexing supported.
Solution:   Handle more than one index in an assignment.
